website_summaries.verdict: This toaster is a good choice if you're looking for a modern toaster that produces an even result every time and can accommodate all types of bread.
pros: Long slots enable you to fit 4 slices of toast at once
Adjustable alert when toast is ready
Lift and Look, bagel, frozen and A Bit More settings
cons: Bread may occasionally get stuck down inside the toaster

customer_reviews.title: All those electronics seem nice, but....
customer_reviews.text: I loved this toast for three months until the electronics started going haywire. Intermittently, it starts over in its toasting countdown when it should be finished, won't release the toast, and generally misbehaves. "Rebooting" sometimes solves the problem, but I have a feeling this is going to get worse. It is past the return time-frame for Amazon, so I guess I need to contact the manufacturer. Update: Nine months in. After the three-month issues, everything seemed fine until today, when it went crazy again. I think I need to go back to an analog toaster without a micro-processor.
customer_reviews.author: Nanakai

customer_reviews.title: Bought new from amazon on January 31 2016, Broken ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought new from amazon on January 31 2016, Broken on November 26th 2017, two adults in the home, no kids, this toaster had very little use, maybe 12 times total, looks brand new, carriage goes up and down on its own, now it blows a fuse every time you push the start button, tried every outlet in home. A $130.00 toaster should last longer then a year and a half. Breville , no help at all.
customer_reviews.author: sf

customer_reviews.title: This toaster comes from the futute
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's over-engineered. Yes it's overpriced. Yes I love it.... my space-aged toaster runs smoothly and delivers toasty perfection. I particularly love the way the toast does not "pop" it emerges on an elevator like a Sith Lord arising from the Abyss.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Very expensive Unsmart smart toaster. Now just fire hazard after 23 months.
customer_reviews.text: The first toaster malfunctioned right away, kept replacement. Seems like the computer chip was way off. Replacement worked for almost exactly 2 yrs. Toasting function was ok, first set of toast everyday was always way underdone. While keeping it at same level, the second set onward would be super dark. I would say it’s not at all smart, and performs much worse than a $30 toaster. Suddenly, won’t stop toasting, will not cancel or release the toast while it keeps toasting. Only thing we could do was unplug it. Would have been a bad fire situation if someone forgot toast. A rather expensive item.
customer_reviews.author: Susnm

customer_reviews.title: Acts weird
customer_reviews.text: Seriously a nice toaster! Big slots and multiple openings. It has a cool "check" option where you can push a button and it'll lift whatever you're toasting so you can glance to see if it's getting burned. There's also "a little more" option where it puts the toast right back in to get toasted a little more for those of us who like the crunchy toast life. The only problem is that sometimes it glitches out. Sometimes the start button doesn't work, and sometimes it never lets your toast back up. It's usually fixable by just unplugging and plugging it back in, but still is annoying for such an expensive toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Completely broken after ONE month of usage! Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a piece of crap. Worst breville product I have ever owned. The first week it had some issues with one of the touch buttons. Gave it a reset and it started working on so decided to give it a go. When it works, it's great. Problem is, just over a month of usage now and it's completely broken down on me. The lights are flashing, none of the buttons are working and my toast is stuck inside... What's worse, I'm out of the return window so now I have to deal with the manufacturer warranty and go through the headache of figuring that out. Most likely a wash.
customer_reviews.author: Ashish V

customer_reviews.title: I'd like to be able to use it. BUT....
customer_reviews.text: This toaster is very nice looking...and when it works, it works very well and has some nice options....however....every other time I try to use it, it pops the GFI outlet. I can plug anything else into same that outlet and it works fine. My old toaster was plugged into it for 7 years and was never a problem. I think the issue is with this toaster. It started the 2nd time that I used it. I haven't used it for 2 months now but I've had it for 5 months so I don't think I can send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Shoe Diva

customer_reviews.title: It's a great toaster, but it's huge
customer_reviews.text: I like all the settings, the fact that you can push a button and check the toastiness without stopping the setting .. It's got bells and whistles and seems to be well made. It's a clean design, actual metal, not metal colored plastic... And it takes up a lot if space. update: I dropped my 5 star rating to 1 after FOUR uses where the lights flash, unplug, replug, breville customer service was unavailable after a 20 minute wait wish I had read more of the negative reviews which detailed the same problem.....this is an expense useless hunk of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Toast
customer_reviews.text: I admit it’s a pricey machine. However, it’s makes perfect toast one slice after the other. It’s quiet, well made (solid) , accommodates just about any size slice of bread & when it’s finished it raises the toast out of the machine. No more digging to get the toast out. I bake artisan style breads & found the lesser machines unable to handle the odd sized bread. This machine is able to toast my bread & muffins perfectly. It is beautifully styled & has a great plug with a molded hole in it for easy unplugging. The only con is that it does not have a retractable cord. Hope you are listening Breville.
customer_reviews.author: Big Tuna

customer_reviews.title: Loved it but stopped working after a year and three months!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this toaster on March 15, 2015. Have loved it and used it extensively. Yesterday, June 16, 2016, it malfunctioned and does not get hot at all. Not working and no toast. I have had cheap toasters that lasted years and years and years. Just over one year for a $179 toaster is unreal. I hope I will be contacted by Breville so that I can figure out what to do now. This does not seem right at all.
customer_reviews.author: Nirvana 1952

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - unreliable JUNK
customer_reviews.text: We had this toaster for 12 months and it worked beautifully. Then - exactly 1 month after warranty was up, it started flaking out on us. Some of the elements no longer work and the timer seems to have a complete mind of its own. For this price, it should work longer than a year. I replaced a 15 year old kitchen aid that was working fine but looked old with this new trendy looking one but it is total junk! I'm going back to a cheap but reliable toaster w/o all of the fancy features that quickly fail. If you buy it, you will be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: ReView4You

customer_reviews.title: Right Capacity, Performance, Wrong Price
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good toaster. The slots are wide enough and long enough to handle Ciabatta slices and bagels, and it toasts evenly! I bought the smaller plastic version based largely on features but it did a rotten job, with a 300 degree difference from one side of a nichrome panel to the other. I was informed that that was as good as I should expect from a (modern) toaster. Bunk! I returned it. This model is grossly overpriced but it's the only one that does an acceptable job after testing 5 others in a row.
customer_reviews.author: L. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toaster back at the end of May, 2018. It's June 2020. It was the perfect toaster for at least a year when things probably started to go downhill. It's been somewhere between 3-4 months now that the toaster is noticeably not working to its best capacity. We have kept it clean and well maintained, but it takes the heating elements way longer to toast now, and one side of the elements doesn't work, so we have to flip the toast and run it through a second time. That's not good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy B

customer_reviews.title: Bravo Breville
customer_reviews.text: I can’t find my original review to edit, so I’m writing a new one. Inner side of both slots stopped working after 1.5 years, of course out of warranty. I contacted Breville and they sent me a mailing slip to mail it back. THEY SENT ME A BRAND NEW TOASTER!!! Now that’s the type of customer support that keeps me buying their products! Bravo Breville, bravo!
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: Center Heater Element Failed
customer_reviews.text: Procured the BTA830XL in Dec 2018. 15 months later the center heating element no longer toasts. The side heating banks still toast as normal. So all bread slices come out toasted on one side only (the side facing the outside of the toaster). Searching online I see this is a fairly common issue. I rarely do Amazon reviews however this is an issue that potential buyers should be aware of. As much as I love every other aspect of this toaster, I regret purchasing it. Contacting Breville to try and procure a replacement center heating element bank is futile. No response from them.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: "Hotel Toast" Per Breville Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the expensive model 830 for $160+. One side is toasted evenly--looks good. The other side is slightly toasted. When I called Breville Customer Service, the representative explained that this performance is per design specifications for "hotel toast." One side is toasted more to handle butter, jelly, etc. that hotel guests add. If you want toast that is evenly toasted on both sides, you need to purchase the model which has a dial. I was unable to ascertain which model he was referencing.
customer_reviews.author: John White

customer_reviews.title: Breville = Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Toaster new in May of 2018 from Amazon. The 1st toaster lasted about 4 months and would not stay down when you pushed the toast button. I called Breville and they sent me out a replacement. Good on that part. Fast forward my toaster now doesn't heat in the middle at all so only one side of the bread gets toasted. I overpaid for the name since I have had great success with the Breville product just not with the toaster and not for the amount of money you pay. I will not be purchasing any other Breville product.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Broken After 1.5 Years
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this 1.5 years and it is broken. It only toasts one side of the bread. This one-sided toasting problem seems to be a recurring problem for people if you read the reviews. Even when it worked fine it still had occasional glitches where it would not toast, toast too long and it never really felt like a great product. Breville only has a 1 year warranty on it so there's nothing that can be done besides get a new toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Shed

customer_reviews.title: Great but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: The special features on this toaster really make a difference. Being able to check the level of doneness and to add just a little extra toasting time is great. Although it has extra long slots to toast four slices at a time, there are "dead spots" on either side that make it less than ideal for long slices of bread. The bottom line is that it's still a toaster and overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Charron

customer_reviews.title: Redefines Toaster!
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical to buy such an expensive toaster, but this one redefines the appliance! The electronic mechanism that controls the lowering and raising of the toast/bagel/etc. is so amazing, together with the precise heating control, and the ultra-wide/long toasting slots, that you will always have the toasted bread/bagel that you wanted. This is a very high quality product and I'm so happy I bought it. I've had it for about 6 months now, which allows me to endorse this toaster with confidence. I hope you will like it too!
customer_reviews.author: Tolerant Elder

customer_reviews.title: Works for a year...then,
customer_reviews.text: Works for a year...then, the heating elements started failing. Now I have toast only on outside. I guess this is how British people have toast, but I like mine toasted on both sides! I have owned this for just over a year. No issues before this came up. Perhaps this is what is called planned obsolescence? In any case, if I were to do this over, I would look elsewhere. I fully expected this to last at least five, six years. So much for that plan. (((
customer_reviews.author: Marc Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Not happy - Updated
customer_reviews.text: Apparently still in warranty which is good since only the outside element on both sides is now working. Tried unplugging since it has a processor. Plugged back in .... same behavior. ADDENDUM. Talked to Breville customer service and they are sending me a new unit. Bumped the review up to 2 stars. Perhaps more after I actually see the replacement and the longevity of it.
customer_reviews.author: Billaban

customer_reviews.title: How to fix it when it malfunctions
customer_reviews.text: I've had this toaster for close to two years and almost junked it. It is great when it works, but periodically all the lights would flash blue and the item being toasted would be trapped within. I've discovered that when the toaster malfunctions, if I lift it up at the end with the controls and tap it sharply on the countertop it cures the problem, albeit for awhile. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne

customer_reviews.title: Best toast, lousy electronics
customer_reviews.text: Makes the best toast of any toaster we've owned, including toaster ovens. Got the long slots to accommodate the odd shaped bread we love to buy. That said, ours does flip out every once in a while, starts flashing lights, and won't give up the toast. And really only once in a while, maybe once every two months or so. So we have to unplug and or bump it a couple of times to reset the electronics. Not sure why. As much as we paid, I would have expected better. If we weren't happy with the toast, this would have been returned. But it really is the best toast ever. Joe
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Futral

customer_reviews.title: I love Breville products!
customer_reviews.text: Great toaster! Despite some of the negative reviews I find nothing wrong with this toaster. There can be some uneven browning if that is a problem for you, but it is heavy, looks nice on the counter, the "just a little bit more" feature is very handy. Easy to use, the light indicators call you back to the kitchen when your toast or waffles are nearly done which is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Mar...

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality and expensive! Keep looking
customer_reviews.text: After using our previous toaster for over 8 yrs..yes 8 yrs..we decided to upgrade. The Brville wowed us with all the bells and whistles, and we decided to take the plunge. Based on the precious toaster e penitence, we thought the breville would last at least last a decade, if not longer. It worked great for the first 6 months, then we started getting under-toasred bread from one of the slots. We were too busy to complain and just used the other slot. Then a few months later, the faulty slot just stopped toasting and by that time we were out of the "warranty" period. We still use it, only on one slot. My recommendation, look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Avantika Mathur

customer_reviews.title: Love This Toaster
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit of a splurge, but I very much love this toaster. I find it toasts very well and allows all sorts of sizes to fit, from thick to thin, short to long - easy to insert and easy to remove. I particularly like the bagel button that allows me to major in browning the cut side of the bagel while just warming up the crust end so it doesn't burn. And the "Bit More" and "Lift and Look" features are real slick. Perhaps the only downside is that I find it hard not to binge on toast. :)
customer_reviews.author: Edward Gianni

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent Toasting Results
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toaster Dec. 2015 and from time to time the toaster wouldn't pop up. Now it toast one side of a slice well and the other side hardly at all. Then sometimes it burns one side and not the other side of the same piece of bread. (no change in setting) You can see the elements work on one side and not the other. Very disappointed with this highy rated and very expensive toaster ! I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: HerkyWV

customer_reviews.title: This toaster is THE BEST!! Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This toaster is great. It cooks evenly, it doesn't have an annoying beep the wakes up the whole house a piece of toast is ready. We make a lot of sourdough toast and the long wide slots are perfect. It's stealth, the way it slowly lowers and raises the toast. I've bought several toasters over the last 10 years, cuisinart, kitchenaid, black & decker, even that one on this site that makes a poached egg...lame, it was like rubber. They all cooked unevenly on both sides after a year or less. Total waste of money. I was starting to hate toasters, because they just didn't produce a simple, evenly toasted piece of bread.
customer_reviews.author: cre8tive1

customer_reviews.title: Poor design, especially for the money
customer_reviews.text: Poor design, especially for the money. Impossible to clean the inside because the slot for the crumbs to fall through to the pull-out tray is tiny and most of them end up sticking to the toaster. Moreover, chunks of bread get stuck between the heating element and the toast holder and are impossible to get out. They burn and make a mess. Lastly, our toaster started to malfunction within a couple of months of purchase. The raising and lowering mechanism doesn't work when it feels like it. Our $30 toaster was a better investment. Terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stupid expensive but love it
customer_reviews.text: Have had the white version of this at another location and loved it but couldn’t justify the cost of the “die cast” — really wish the cheaper one came in black to fit in with the decor here. After waiting like two years for a price break I finally just splurged and paid the ridiculous price. There is absolutely NO reason to spend any extra money on the “die cast” version. It does NOT look better or more expensive than the white one. Both look good and work great. But I do love it.
customer_reviews.author: You K

customer_reviews.title: It worked fine until April/May of 2017
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this model in December of 2016. It worked fine until April/May of 2017, when it started to not toast evenly, then went to no color, then almost burned the toast, all on approximately the same setting???!!! We went on a long weekend vacation, so I unplugged all my appliances. When we got back after a couple of days we plugged in the toaster to use it and it was dead. Tried it in everyone of my outlets and NOTHING. I just want my money back. Should have lasted for years instead of months!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Janell I. Buermann

customer_reviews.title: My favorite toaster, ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Breville toaster. Had my first one for over 15 years and lost it in a recent move. These are the Mack-Daddy of toasters! If anyone had ever told me I’d be willing to spend this much on a toaster I would have laughed. But the way the toast turns out...it’s lije your toast has been loved to the perfect dry crispness. Takes a little longer, but to me, the way the toast comes out, it’s well worth the wait.
customer_reviews.author: Hanoverian girl

customer_reviews.title: Did not work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this model for the granddaughter because she has limited counter space. It did not work the first time tried to use it. Called Breville and they said to return it. Amazon sent out another within a few days and it seems to be working OK the last few days. If she has another failure, I will return it and get a refund and get the 4 slice toaster like we have had for several years without a problem
customer_reviews.author: Larry Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Uneven toasting, but great features
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for the large size slots. I love being able to toast real bread now! I also love the Little Bit More feature. So handy!! However, I'm disappointed in this toaster because it doesn't toast evenly. You can even see some of the elements don't get red. I gotta take off stars for that. What's the point of an expensive toaster if can't toast evenly, just like cheap toasters? Anyhow, I'm keeping it because I'm lazy and I like everything else about it. Maybe one day someone will invent a toaster that toasts evenly!!
customer_reviews.author: BDW

customer_reviews.title: Never have I had a toaster that makes perfect toast like this one
customer_reviews.text: Never have I had a toaster that makes perfect toast like this one. It brings it up enough when done so you don't need wooden tongs to get the toast out. Quiet, smooth working, and the long two sides makes it easy to toast the large sourdough bread we buy from the bakery, or put two regular size pieces of bread in one side.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan V.

customer_reviews.title: It had many features i liked.. So now it is on our counter ...
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this toaster. It had many features i liked .. So now it is on our counter and looks great, its performance is not as good. The lights and features that looked to me like a good idea are worthless. The lights show cancel when they should be heating and flashing when it shouldn't. On and on. Truly it is driving me crazy . I would advise you not to buy this toaster. I am so sorry I spent the money on this appliance. Get a basic toaster. This is not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Susa

customer_reviews.title: Uneven Toasting
customer_reviews.text: This was my second Breville toaster. The first was a 4-slice Smart model which worked flawlessly for four years, until making a household move when the wiring went crazy. Replaced it with this one, as I'd had excellent performance and quality with other Greville products I own and use and liked the longer slots. The construction is flimsy compared to my first one, but more important, the toasting is uneven, sometimes even burning the bottoms and barely browning the tops. Very disappointed. I am replacing this one, but not with a Breville.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good toast but has its faults
customer_reviews.text: the one down side that other reviews have made mention of is that the unit will on occasion go randomly on the fritz. It will flash all of it's lights, won't release the toast, and won't accept toast unless you fiddle with it by cleaning out the unit, unplugging it, cursing at it, and then it will magically start working again. We have not contacted the manufacturer because it happens only occasionally. If it starts happening more frequently, we'll probably take our concerns to the next level. Great toaster, otherwise. Just be wary of the critical reviews.
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: Electrical problems with this toaster
customer_reviews.text: We had this toaster for less than 2 years. It had major electrical problems that blew a circuit in our house when it finished it's cycle of toasting. We are very disappointed this toaster failed in such a short time as it was very expensive. The unit looks nice and we liked the features but poor electronic components.
customer_reviews.author: James Artman

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: Wrote this before the toaster quit working on 10/22/2018. Love this toaster. Better than expected Update: purchased in August 2018, delivered on August 22. Have used this toaster about a dozen times. Today October 23 it broke. Toast went down, never came back up. Just started flashing and then clicking. For $180 bucks I expected this to last for years, not a couple of months. Next step. See what manufacturer says.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 Weeks
customer_reviews.text: I should have payed more attention to the reviews warning of center heating element failures. My unit lasted 2 weeks when it stopped toasting the center side of bread and bagels. Also the heat distribution is poor, giving burned ends and under toasted centers of bread and bagels.
customer_reviews.author: Len K

customer_reviews.title: Worth spending a bit more!
customer_reviews.text: This must be the finest toaster on the market. Solid, easy to use, and makes perfect toast every time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Delivered with used crumbs inside and brushed steel marked
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing, Delivered with CRUMBS in dray and burnt-on food on toaster. also, the brushed steel was marked and scratched by shipping package. This was a total breakdown in quality checking. and at $170. for a freaking toster unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: WA HANSEN

customer_reviews.title: it works awesome! Beautiful toast every time
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it works awesome! Beautiful toast every time, really cool features like the "bit more" and lift and look button. Looks good on the counter too. About once a week it stays down and all the lights flash and you have to dig the toast out. If you unplug it before digging the toast out it will not reset, if you dig the toast out and unplug it and you can use it again for another week. But it works awesome during that week! Kinda like buying a $180 Microsoft toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Enos

customer_reviews.title: Love this toaster
customer_reviews.text: My parents have one of the Breville toasters. It was difficult to pay this much for a toaster, but the performance so far has been great. For food that is so easy to make it is surprisingly difficult to get a toast that will consistently and evenly toast piece after piece. The Breville does! I chose this model as I like the artisan breads that have larger slices which I had to cut in half for other toasters. The Breville long slot accommodates these as they are, no need to cut it fit the toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Toaster of the (5) Stars. . . .
customer_reviews.text: I am the last person I thought would be able to write "I love a toaster" but darn, this thing is like a die-cast ingot of toaster perfect. If Mercedes Benz made a toaster, this would be their Maybach model. Toasts and/or defrosts frozen bagels, long slices of rye bread, evenly to any level of crispness this side of Dante's Inferno. Simple, smooth mechanism. It even gives you kind of an "oooch more" button if you want just a tiny eensy bit of additional toasting. Just an awesome piece of kitchen machinery.
customer_reviews.author: D_ElH

customer_reviews.title: God’s Toaster
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toaster almost 7 years ago. This is what God would use if He wanted some toast. Sturdy, reliable, consistent.
customer_reviews.author: MemeBag

customer_reviews.title: Heating Element Goes Bad
customer_reviews.text: This is my second expensive Breville product and both have had electronic issues. In each case I purchased the "high end" product for presumed quality as well as aesthetics. Though it still looks nice, this toaster has suddenly started toasting on one side only and not very evenly. You can visually see only outer heating elements glow when toasting. Just out of warranty, unfortunately, so will have to buy another toaster. Perhaps it is better to buy a cheap toaster and throw it out in a year when/if it goes bad! I really hate to say that as I do not wish to contribute more to our "throw away" culture.
customer_reviews.author: RES

customer_reviews.title: Heating element failed after 16 months
customer_reviews.text: This toaster worked really well for about 16 months until one of the heating elements melted through. Breville has a service center nearby, so I’ll see if it can be repaired. I think a one-year warranty for a toaster this pricey ($160) is a little short. Not sure whether I’ll buy another one if this one can’t be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Don C

customer_reviews.title: Does not toast evenly...
customer_reviews.text: We have had this toaster for less than a year and as nice as the toaster looks and seems to work it never toasts evenly. One side of our toast is always burnt while the other is barely toasted. My cousins have this toaster and love it, theirs seems to work perfectly. Not sure what the deal is but I would consider the price on this toaster... it might not be worth it. Wasn't for us.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: The BEST Toaster Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best toaster you will ever have. I absolutely LOVE this toaster. It is worth every penny. I love the bit more option along with the checking progress option. It toasts everything perfectly. I have figured out the settings I want depending on the item I am toasting, bread, waffle, bagel, or roll. It also depends on the age of the bread as to what setting you may want. I have been using it for over a year, and still love it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Both outside burners have quit working.
customer_reviews.text: Love the design and features, but after two years it has stopped toasting on both outside burners which means we have to flip the bread to get the second side toasted. It’s like the opposite of the bagel setting, but I like both sides of the bread toasted.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Einstein

customer_reviews.title: I loved this toaster...while it worked
customer_reviews.text: For just over a year we loved our futuristic, beautiful toaster. And then one side stopped working. Fortunately I had read the reviews, and felt nervous enough about the ridiculous investment to purchase the Asurion protection. I sent it to them, piece of cake, they said they couldn’t fix it and immmedately issued me a $177 gift card. When does THAT ever go as smoothly as an unbroken toaster? Anyway, I plan to use the money on a plebeian toaster and spend the other $120 on something durable.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Watts

customer_reviews.title: Now toasts on only one side, customer service is nonexistent
customer_reviews.text: After about a year or so of use, the toaster gave of a big spark, and since then has stopped toasting on both sides. All my attempts at reaching out to customer service (calling, filling out online form, emailing) have been completely useless. Most of the time they do not respond, and when talking to someone on the phone after waiting forever, the phone line just disconnects (I don't normally have this issue) and no one bothers calling back. Did not expect this from this company, and after paying so much for this toaster!!
customer_reviews.author: Mar Y.

customer_reviews.title: defective - had to return after 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: The toaster worked beautifully for 19 days. Then one day all the buttons locked (were lit up, but would not respond to touch). It made a slight, yet detectable clicking sound every two seconds. The toaster would not respond to any buttons. I unplugged the toaster, thinking it might re-set after being disconnected for 30+ seconds. When I plugged it back in, the same issue continued. I unplugged it for rest of the day. It worked fine the next morning. Two days later, the same exact issues happened for my wife. We're disappointed because it worked nicely for 2 1⁄2 weeks. We're obviously returning this item. We will buy another brand for much less money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Short-lived and dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this toaster and its features at first, but about nine months in, it almost caused a fire in my home when it failed to stop or pop up at the end of the toasting cycle, causing a piece of bread to catch fire. I had to unplug it to stop it. Upon complaining to Breville, it sent me a replacement of the same model. After just six months of use, the elements on the right slot stopped working on the new one. At this price, these kind of safety and longevity issues are unacceptable. I have since moved on to a cheaper model of a competitor and it is doing a superior job of toasting.
customer_reviews.author: Bostonian

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 15 months
customer_reviews.text: Almost $200 for a toaster - I could have bought ten for this price. I wanted event toasted bread. Worked great for 15 months. Stopped working on the 16th month. Warranty is 12 months. They say they will replace it, but I must drive it 40 miles to a UPS drop off. I would NOT recommend this purchase to anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: IAmTheWolf

customer_reviews.title: Love the ability adjust size of bread (Bagel) and also ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the ability adjust size of bread (Bagel) and also toast just one side. Also love all the other features: toast a little more, lift to see, status light... For me, the cost of this item is worth it. Best toaster I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon

customer_reviews.title: and he loved watching the lights count down 😂 It's a solid
customer_reviews.text: My housemate is a rocket scientist, and he loved watching the lights count down 😂 It's a solid, lovely appliance. It doesn't toast perfectly evenly, but in prefer that. When I spread butter or oil on the bread it absorbs it at different rates, and makes for random tastier bites. I purchased the refurbished version and it came nicely packaged with a manual and looks pristine on our countertops!
customer_reviews.author: AMYGIFT L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Waow.. I really liked this toaster. Let's be honest, it is expensive.. However, considering my toasters break every 18 months or so, this might pay itself off. It is high quality as could be expected from Breville. The most important points for me was the fact that it is fully automated, it has a frozen button (for frozen bread slices) as well as "lift and look" button.. It works great, toasts great.. The crumb tray is quite high quality and not cheap like some of the other toasters I had. I am happy, even though it was expensive. It seems to be worth it for me so far.
customer_reviews.author: SDR

customer_reviews.title: A Toaster With Everything
customer_reviews.text: Really a beautiful looking toaster that carries a bang . Easy to use settings to get toast perfection . Love being able to toast any size breads . The only draw back we see is it’s a little pricey but it has everything we were looking for in a toaster . We’re very happy with this purchase .
customer_reviews.author: Hot Tights

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: It is a solid and beautiful toaster. It toasts beautifully various types and sizes of breads and bagels. I hope it will continue to work well. I will revise my review if there are unexpected malfunctions.
customer_reviews.author: A Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 3 years.
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this toaster 5 stars because I have loved this toaster so much. We have even bought them as gifts. And, in all honesty, I'm about to buy it again. I hardly used it for 2 of those years because of eating keto. BUT - visiting family got a piece of bread stuck inside. My husband turned it upside down over the sink to shake it out, like you would with any toaster. He didn't hit it or anything. We plugged it back in and it no longer worked. Totally bummed. For this price, it should have been made better.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Toaster is fine so far.
customer_reviews.text: I love the product...has worked great so far. I have a 2 slice Farberware that I've had for 45 years. It still works great, but I get tired of cutting bread in half and shoving too thick slices of bread in and then unplugging the toaster to get out. Just wanted to say...my Mom had a Sunbeam 2 slice that would lower and raise the toast automatically. Old school, she probably got it in the 40-50's. But it still worked in 2001. Even had a fiber/cloth wrapped cord! And it was gorgeous. Stainless and beautiful. Wish I had that! Feel the need to unplug this one between uses. Worried it will use electricity to monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon buyer

customer_reviews.title: Buy It Once
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing this, I read the reviews. I would agree, 100%, that although it is expensive, I would purchase again. And it was hard for me to purchase looking at the price. To me, it is a matter of, do you want to purchase a toaster once, or multiple times trying to find a good one. Three toasters later, I have spent approximately the same price and do not anticipate needing to replace this one. Bread sliced from a loaf, english muffins, bagels, bread, all toasted equally well.
customer_reviews.author: ckfrmn

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money have had it for over six months
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of buying relatively inexpensive toasters and having to replace them frequently. So, I bought an expensive toaster, the Breville BTA830XL. Unfortunately the heating elements on this toaster are also burning out. The features are great but if it will not last a year, it simply is not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Rich R.

customer_reviews.title: Burns food and broke after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: The sliding time duration switch has to be set to the far left and is very sensitive. I found it really hard to dial it in just perfectly between family members and it seems inconsistent. My biggest problem is that now, just after the 1 year warranty has expired, it is broken. The inside element on the right hand side doesn't heat up and the left hand side heats up but not as hot as the outside elements. I have to flip bread around and re-toast to try and get consistently toasted bread.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R

customer_reviews.title: Love this Toaster
customer_reviews.text: I would give this toaster 5 stars but you wouldn't believe I hadn't been paid for this commercial. Haven't had a toaster in years so have no idea about a comparison. The mechanics are smooth. It doesn't have many computerized gadgets so hopefully won't break. It does have just what I need, It's wide and long, fits any size bread, has an option for toasting frozen bread as well as bagels. What else is there to do with toast except spend an exorbitant amount on a toaster which was worth it. Of lesser importance but important to me, it has a beautiful finish. We've been using it since December.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Cole

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: The reason for only 4 stars is because I have only been using it for a couple of weeks. So far everything is functional although I have not tried to do a bagel. I don't eat them. Bread is toasted more uniformly than any other toaster I have had, although a little more heavily on the outside coils then the inside coils. There is a little variance there. If it is still functioning properly in a year I will update the review. For the price, it needs to work correctly for several years, otherwise it is way over-priced.
customer_reviews.author: vicki

customer_reviews.title: This toaster is AWESOME! Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This toaster is AWESOME! Worth every penny. I love it because my kiddos grimy handprints don't show. No dials to get all gross with their little messy hands when they make toast. Love the up and down mechanisms too. Totally recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: S. McVey

customer_reviews.title: This toaster has burned every bagel I have put in ...
customer_reviews.text: This toaster has burned every bagel I have put in it. It is at the lowest setting, but I have to watch it each time. I have purchased a two slice and do not have that problem. I wish I could return it as I think the settings are a bit off, as the lever doesn't go all the way down. 'Certainly not worth the money. 'Been fussing with it since January when it arrived. Lotti
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Most expensive toaster I’ve ever purchased.
customer_reviews.text: This toaster is a tank. Looks good, toasts evenly and consistently. We purchased this toaster because it has long slots for wide bread slices.
customer_reviews.author: PostOak

customer_reviews.title: Awesome look.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing toaster. I mean, it toasts great, as a new toaster should. But I mainly bought it cause it looks awesome, and it has the double length slots for the longer bakery bread. Nice brushed steel look, had it a couple weeks and so far it doesn't show fingerprints or smudges. Sorta spendy for a toaster but, people buy trinkets or paintings and all to just sit there and look pretty, this has a function so the price didn't bother me because I wasn't just looking for something to toast toast.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I've never owned a toaster that so perfectly toasted bread before. Every piece of bread I stuff in there, both frozen and room temperature come out evenly cooked and delicious. I hope to own this one very expensive appliance for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jarjoura

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this toaster
customer_reviews.text: Until now, I have never had a toaster that makes perfect toast. I love the "lift" feature that lets me peek at the toast's progress without interrupting the cycle. You can add a little more time to the cycle with the push of a button. Not all breads are the typical square, usual mass-produced size, and this toaster takes that into account. The wide slots will hold halved demi-baguettes or big slices from homemade or store-bought artisanal loaves.
customer_reviews.author: Midori Chadwick

customer_reviews.title: wonderful toaster
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Just wow. No wonder this is the highest rated toaster I could find. This thing is fantastic! A lot of money, yeah. But worth it. Only thing to get used to is that the darkness setting goes to like 10 or something, which is way burned. We leave ours on about 2 & 1/2. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Cast Iron Chef

customer_reviews.title: Uneven cooking, outside cooks faster than inside and top faster than bottom
customer_reviews.text: Returning the item, toasts bread fine but frozen waffles on regular or frozen setting do not brown evenly. one side burns before the other is fully brown. This is the second toaster that i have tried, first one was a cheap $20 one from bed bath and beyond. Will buy another of this model to see if it is a quality control issue.
customer_reviews.author: Demi

customer_reviews.title: Breville’s customer service rocks
customer_reviews.text: I have had this toaster almost two years. A couple of weeks ago there must have been a power surge because I heard a popping noise and one side stopped working. I contacted Breville and they sent me a prepaid postage label to get it repaired. They repaired it for free and it is as good as new. Amazing customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Stemwedel

customer_reviews.title: TOASTER SUPREME
customer_reviews.text: This toaster is too cool. Another superior product from Breville ... the toast rack grabs your sliced bread/bagel and automatically lowers them into the toasting chamber at the touch of a button. Additional buttons allow you to "peek" at your toast by automatically raising the toasting cage, and lowering the toast/bagel back down into the toaster for just a bit of additional toasting! Breville is an Australian firm - I own their largest countertop toaster oven (fab, too) and I just ordered their pressure cooker for the kitchen. Buy their products with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Aldocella

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 years. Warranty is 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 2 years. Half of the coils stopped functioning. Good concept, I like lift and look and led show how much time left, and “a little bit more” is great (though usually a little too little). Seems poor quality for a toaster this expensive to die so quickly. Soapbox time: There is so much junk and waste in the world. I’d rather buy a toaster that will last, and would pay more for it.
customer_reviews.author: Someone from Portland

customer_reviews.title: Breaks/Sticks Constantly!
customer_reviews.text: This Toaster is absolutely awful. When it works (which is rare) you can count on different levels of toasting on the opposite slot. The lights look fancy and the peek feature is good idea...but the toaster gets stuck all the time. At first, I'd simply unplug the toaster, plug it back in and then slots would release on their own. Now, the toaster gets stuck and it will not release. I can honestly say this is the worst toaster I've ever purchased. I expected a lot more from Breville. Save your money and buy a Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Jared P.

customer_reviews.title: Failure to launch
customer_reviews.text: Toaster looks great and works some of the time. We’ve had it for 4 months and it has stated not popping up after cooking. We usually have to unplug and plug back in. I don’t really feel like it toasts evenly but more worried about not being able to get our food out of it. I have contacted Breville but have not heard back yet
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This toaster is a great concept and we enjoyed it for all of a ...
customer_reviews.text: This toaster is a great concept and we enjoyed it for all of a month before it just completely stopped working. Luckily it conked out the exact day before it would have been too late to return to Amazon. Asking for a refund, I don't even want a replacement. It's a shiny and expensive piece of junk. Buyer beware!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: They all look great but eventually stop working
customer_reviews.text: After "burning" through multiple toatsters I finally found one that works. They all look great but eventually stop working. The Breville cost much more but it's worth it. I spent 3 x this amount on all the toasters I thought would be good and then died within a few months to a year so I would have been better off spending the money to begin with for the Breville. It's a well made, well functioning toaster with great features. Spend the money- it's worth it- a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Navicular

customer_reviews.title: Beautful work great, worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Beautful work great, worth every penny. Love breville products. We've had an espresso for going on 3 years. Great, we did have issues with the first one, we had to have it repaired 2 times underwarrenty, still had issues finally they totally replaced the machine with a new one and it couldn't be better. Company was easy to work with.
customer_reviews.author: John pearson

customer_reviews.title: This toaster is a complete JOY to use.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Breville has done it again. As with the vast majority of Breville products, they do come at a premium. Having said that, you basically get what you pay for. As for toasting, it would be hard to beat this product for general toasting needs. I have used it with: bagels, sandwich thins, regular sandwich bread and thick "Texas Toast" size bread without any challenges. Quality workmanship, sturdy, stylishly attractive, functional and efficient. It does require a bit more room than a standard toaster, but if you have the space it is certainly worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Howard M

customer_reviews.title: and instead of going cheap and replacing it every few years I decided to see if this Breville toaster would impress me as much a
customer_reviews.text: My toaster died, and instead of going cheap and replacing it every few years I decided to see if this Breville toaster would impress me as much as my Blender and Microwave oven I spent more for but was thoroughly happy I did. great products, made of quality parts that exceed your expectations. This toaster rocks, and the "A bit more" button is great to keep toast warm while you are putting butter on individual slieds
customer_reviews.author: Glenn J  Baker

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioning After only 1 month!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed with this Toaster. It's very pretty on my counter but only used occasionally. It is now malfunctioning after the return period has expired. Be prepared to lose close to $200 if you buy this expensive toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Stone Purdy

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful toaster. Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I've been deprived of a decent piece of toast for nearly 9 years. This is a wonderful toaster. Well worth the money. I have a large family so the amount of bagels and waffles that I can now fit in and toast to perfection has doubled. I love all the settings, I have had great bread, bagels, and waffles from this thing! A must have!
customer_reviews.author: Shoppashop

customer_reviews.title: Beware the microprocessor; it is unreliable
customer_reviews.text: After only a few months, the microprocessor that runs the elevator feature started going on the fritz. Randomly it would not send the signal for the toaster to release and bring up the toasted bread, and it would remain down in the toaster. One had to unplug the toaster then use very thin tongs or other implements to dig out the toast. At first, waiting a few hours, then plugging back in would reset the toaster. But the glitch began happening frequently, and in the end, no amount of plugging/unplugging would "fix" the issue. We finally gave up. This is far too expensive a toaster to have a flaw like this.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Hard to overstate how good this toaster is
customer_reviews.text: Hard to overstate how good this toaster is. I mean, how good can a toaster be? Is it really worth $180? The answers: Pretty darn awesome and absolutely. This thing produces perfect toast every time. My wife and I argue over how toasted proper toast should be. She thinks it should be barely warm and I think it should be well tanned. We both get what we want with this toaster and it looks beautiful on the charcoal granite counter top while its doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: great unit
customer_reviews.text: Gets alot of use and 8 months in... two elements burned out. Bummer. One call to Breville and a new one was delivered, no hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Well engineered, high quality
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely well engineered quality product which can toast up to 4 slices of bread at a time. The side exteriors remain cool, so it isn't likely to burn you. The fact that it lowers the bread itself and raises the toast up when it is finished toasting is so cool. This is without the best toaster I've ever owned. Kudos to the engineers and manufacturer for making such a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas D Becker

customer_reviews.title: Great Toaster
customer_reviews.text: I have had this toaster for a few months now. I absolutely love it! It cooks everything perfectly. I use the frozen button a lot when I am warming up a frozen pastry and it gets the center hot every time. I love the auto "up" and "down" feature. No more scaring you. It essentially counts down how much time is left. I have ordered my parents one for Christmas. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: stella&roxy

customer_reviews.title: Not really different from other toasters in practical function
customer_reviews.text: It does what it claims to do, but it toasts bread no differently than any other toaster. The difference is that it is motorized.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Informercial was a bit wrong but it's a good fancy toaster.
customer_reviews.text: So I had brought this to Asia and after using a transformer, it worked well. It didn't burn the bread and it seems to be like what was shown by the girl in the infomercial. I'd rate it higher but the informercial was wrong about 2 things: 1. Toaster still needs to be flipped upside down to clean thoroughly 2. Toaster sides get too hot to touch
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Element failure after only 20 months lite use.  Screwed.
customer_reviews.text: Only my wife and I us this toaster — maybe 4 times per week. After only 20 months an entire element has failed. Simply inexcusable for a toaster of this reputed caliber. Its cost is due to electronics, not overall component quality. Spare yourself the trouble and buy a cheaper analog model. Who cares if it’s not as sleek and sexy ... at least it will likely last as long as this overpriced and under-performing model from Breville.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Diehl

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Great features, holds virtually any size bread, near perfect toasting. Very pleased. Been using now for a few months. A bit pricey.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: The Best toaster ever!
customer_reviews.text: We had toasters, and toaster-ovens. But this IS THE BEST TOASTER that I've ever seen. It is top quality all the way around. It is very well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Robert Kipfer

product_meta.title: Breville Smart Toaster, 14.9 x 7.7 x 7.5 inches, Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: Style Name:NewHow do you toast any type of bread and get it just the way you like it? The Breville BTA830XL Die-cast Smart Toaster has one touch 'Lift and Look' toasting carriage which automatically moves up and down to show the browning process without interrupting the toasting cycle, as well as features one touch 'A Bit More' which allows you to add a little extra time to the toasting cycle for any shaped bread. Motorized carriage with push button controls include both a Bagel setting and a Frozen setting.
feature_bullets: NOTE : Bagel mode has a feature that activates additional heat to the middle heating elements to perfectly toast the insides of cut bagel without burning the outside
NOTE : It is normal for the outside heating elements to appear off or on a lower power during the bagel setting
NOTE : Kindly check the User Manual which is available below for referece
LED toasting progress indicator. Voltage- 110- 120 volts
4 Slice long slot capacity for larger artisanal bread, thick bagels and dense pastries
1600 Watt element features Cool-touch brushed die-cast metal body
